intro: Harpalium truxillense, commonly known as the Truxillense Harpalium, is a species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, often in disturbed or secondary forests. Its botanical features include small, fragrant flowers and a root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
